intro: Psychotria damasiana, commonly known as the "Cocaine Plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions of Mexico, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. It contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which has led to its historical and contemporary significance in pharmacology and illicit drug use. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is also of interest in ethnobotanical and ecological studies.
